A word
A look
A smile
A kiss

title: Time after Time
body:
Written for day 6 of @jonxsansafanfiction Love Song Event based on the prompt “Time after Time” by Cyndi Lauper

Jon Snow knows that if he kisses Sansa Stark she will die. After all, that’s what happened in all those other lifetimes where they found each other. But this time will be different. Because Jon will leave the Tarly household to give Sansa a chance to live happily ever after.  

semi-modern au, reincarnation au

Jon’s suitcase laid open on his bed. He didn’t bother to fold his clothes when he put them in it. He didn’t bother to protect his books when he threw them on top. He just had to get away from here. He had to get away from here now and it didn’t matter where he would go. As long as he would go far away from her she would be fine. If he would go far away from her he wouldn’t end up kissing her. And if he wouldn’t end up kissing her, she wouldn’t die.

“Really, Jon?” Sansa raised her eyebrows when he carried the heavy suitcase down the stairs. “Am I so repulsive that you just pack your bags and leave?”

She wasn’t. She truly wasn’t. She was the most beautiful woman on earth. She was the kindest soul he had ever met. She was everything he wanted and even more.

He wanted her. He needed her. He longed for her. But he couldn’t tell her that. He barely knew her.

She had just walked through that door yesterday as the new nanny of the Tarly children. She had worn the smile on her face he had fallen in love with so many lifetimes ago. She had carried a certain confidence in this life that suited her. And she had also been bolder than she used to be, as if a fire within her had driven her straight into his arms.

But it wasn’t a fire. It wasn’t desire. It wasn’t a burning passion. It was a curse.

They would fall in love. They would kiss and then he would live on while she would die in his arms.

But not anymore. Not this time. Not in this life.

In this life Sansa would live long, very long. She would fall in love with someone else. She would kiss him without dying. She would make love to him. She would become a mother and then eventually she would die of old age.

He owed her that. He owed her one life without him. He owed her one life that lasted longer than the few years she usually got. He owed her one life where she would not meet disaster when she believed to have found her happily ever after.

“You can at least talk to me!” She raised her voice and clenched her hands to fists.

“I’ve got a new job, Sansa. That’s all. It’s nothing personal.” He shrugged and headed for the front door, but Sansa jumped in between him and the way out.

“You have?” She crossed her arms over her chest. “And when did you apply for it? Why didn’t you tell me yesterday, when you introduced yourself as the head of the household? When didn’t you tell me last night, when we walked through the garden and had a conversation that made me believe that maybe there could grow more between us?”

Jon swallowed. “We barely know each other, Sansa. I’m not gonna share such things with a stranger.” He wanted to walk past her, but Sansa once more blocked his path.

“We didn’t talk like strangers do. You didn’t behave like a stranger does.” She lifted her chin and straightened her back.

Jon placed his suitcase on the stone cold floor. “Why does it matter, Sansa? You are the new nanny here, I have a new job.” He sounded harsh, way harsher than he liked to be, but it was for her own good. This was the only way to give her a life, a long life, a happy life, a life without him. “We had some nice talks yesterday and it was great to get to know you, but now I move on.”

“I don’t believe you.” Sansa hissed between her teeth. “You would have said something when you introduced yourself to me.”

Jon shook his head. “You don’t know me. How do you know what I’d do?”

“I just know this is not like you!” She screamed now and Jon firmly grabbed her wrists.

“You’re waking up the kids and the entire house.” He whispered.

“Don’t you want to say goodbye to them? Or didn’t you tell them either that you were leaving?” Sansa cocked her head and she locked her glance with his.

For once he really wanted to do the right thing instead of the selfish thing.

And now she chose this moment to be difficult. “The truth, Jon Snow.” Her nose was dangerously close to his. “Why do I feel like I know you? And why do you leave like a thief in the night just after I’ve arrived and we’ve had this amazing evening?”

Jon swallowed. He was out of lies and out of excuses. And he was afraid that even if he managed to come up with one, she still wouldn’t believe him. “Because you’ll die when I kiss you.” He blurted the words out and reluctantly he stared at Sansa’s face.

Her eyes widened. Her jaw dropped. She opened her mouth to say something, but closed it again, most likely because the right words simply didn’t want to come.

“We’re cursed. We meet life after life after life. And every time we kiss you die.” His heart almost broke through his ribcage and he could hear the blood rushing through his own veins. “And I don’t want that anymore. I don’t want to kill you. Not this time.”

She still stared at him without saying a word and then she wrapped her arms around him and pressed her lips on his.

Jon froze. He tensed all his muscles and tried to push her away.

But Sansa didn’t let him. She kept her lips firmly on his and he felt his resistance falter.

His hands slid around her waist and he closed his eyes while he opened his mouth to let her tongue in. And he waited. He waited and waited and waited, until she would stop moving, would stop breathing, would stop living.

But she didn’t. She pressed her entire body to his and for the first time in many many years a genuine smile appeared on his face.

He wasn’t sure how long it would last. He wasn’t sure how far they could go this time. But he would take whatever he could get.

blog.description: 'He love her and she loved him' Shannon, 25, likes Jon Snow, Baeylo Ren and Chocolate

summary: Break Up With Your Girlfriend, I’m Bored
title: Break Up With Your Girlfriend, I’m Bored
body:
Summary:  Jon and Dany split up, but when they see each other at the club, they both know what’s going to happen…

Notes: As you know, I am taking part in a challenge on tumblr by user @jonerysfics and @mhysaofdragons in which for seven days from Valentines day I am uploading a new one shot. The prompts have been provided and the stories have all been written and I gotta say you’re in for a lot of Jonerys content. So Day 6, 19th February, which is when I’m uploading this, the prompt I chose was ‘Make up Sex’. Basically Ariana is a queen and I wrote this cus why not. Not full on Make-up sex but jealousy and lust and yeeeeeeeee

Link: https://archiveofourown.org/works/17854064

—–

She was dancing, freely and full of vigour as the sleazy tunes filled her ears and possessed her very being. She’d already seen him here, with his new girlfriend she’d heard about, redhead and too good for the filthy man he was. She knew he’d seen her too, a stalling moment in the corner of her eye to where an intense gaze of lust immediately replaced it, and so the game had begun.

summary: I find it amusing how people act like Ned is this amazing liar b/c of Jon like all he did was claim him as his son, who was...
question: I find it amusing how people act like Ned is this amazing liar b/c of Jon like all he did was claim him as his son, who was going to doubt him? Nobody would expect him to claim a child that isn't him. Also why don't people in the series wonder how Lyanna died? They knew R took her and they even accept that he raped her but somehow never consider the fact that she could have been pregnant? It feels like lazy writing to have characters not consider this just to keep the mystery.
answer: I’m honestly shocked that GRRM thought Jon’s parentage was such a mystery that it was the only thing D&D had to answer before he handed them the show. It’s obvious! In fact, Ned’s honor should have brought more scrutiny especially if he found Lyanna and came back with a baby. The last time he and Ashara were in the same place (Harrenhal- mid 281) was two years prior (Jon was found in mid to late 283). Jon would have been too young for anyone to think he was 9 months old or older. Yet no one questioned him despite the fact that people thought Lyanna either left willingly or was kidnapped by Rhaegar.

summary: Do you think Jon will face a dilemma where he has to choose between marrying Sansa to become a Stark or marrying D/ny to not...
question: Do you think Jon will face a dilemma where he has to choose between marrying Sansa to become a Stark or marrying D/ny to not father a bastard? Seems to be his ultimate conflict of the heart.  His wish of becoming a Stark and his fear of fathering a bastard. I think the pregnancy is coming (Not a baby tho). It would be a missed opportunity to not do this.
answer:
Hey, nonnies!

I’m going to answer both these asks in one go since they’re both about Jon and the potential baby. Honestly, at this point, I feel I spend more time talking about this b0atie than J0nereys stans do and, to tell you the truth, he’s the least interesting aspect about season 8, as far as I’m concerned. 

Do you think Jon will face a dilemma where he has to choose between marrying Sansa to become a Stark or marrying D/ny to not father a bastard? Seems to be his ultimate conflict of the heart.

I don’t think that’s a conflict at all. I’m pretty much 100% sure that if Jon’s choice is between becoming a Stark and marrying D*ny in order not to father a bastard, he’s going to pick marrying D*ny every single time. Jon dreams about becoming a Stark but he would never do that if it was at the detriment of someone he loves. That’s just not him. 

Now if it was a choice between marrying Sansa for love or marrying D*ny out of duty for his child, that’s a conflict of the heart. However, in that case as well, I think Jon would choose marrying D*ny because he’s the kind of person who is willing to sacrifice himself for the benefit of others, particularly his own kid. 

However, I doubt it would ever come to that because there’s D*ny to consider. People seem to take for granted that if Jon were to ask her to marry him, she would say yes and I have to wonder why that is. 

Let’s put this into perspective: 

In season 6, D*ny broke up with Daario because she couldn’t bring her concubine to Westeros if she hoped to make a politically advantageous match. She didn’t love him, of course, and I suppose she, at least. thinks she’s in love with Jon. But would that be enough to marry him? Does she love him more than she loves the idea of her becoming queen of Westeros? If s7 is any indication, the answer is a resounding NO. 

At the moment, Jon is definitely not an advantageous match for her. He’s a bastard with no title and no lands, she’s stripped of his crown and in doing so she lost him the support of the North. I doubt at this point, Jon could hold the North for her as his Warden, let alone present a beneficial match for her in terms of geopolitics or legitimacy. She’d be better served marrying someone like Sweet Robin or even Sam or Jaime. Definitely not Jon. 

After the parentage reveal, things become even trickier because Jon’s claim to the throne supersedes hers in every way and the only way for her to ascend the throne with no conflict is if he completely renounces his claim. That bars him from marrying her because he would never be viewed as her prince consort. He would always be seen as having more legitimacy than her. If she wants to put that issue to rest, she can’t marry him. 

I think D*ny is quite content to keep Jon as he is right now: her new and improved Daario, her lover, her subject and her supporter. There’s nothing that indicates to me that she wants to marry him. And if Jon were to propose marriage as a result of her being pregnant, I think she would tell him just that. Which would, of course, kill whatever love Jon could ever muster for her. 

What if s8 ends with Jon returning home to Sansa from the war with Dany’s baby (Dany died) just like Ned came home with Jon to Catelyn….

In regards to this second ask, I’ve talked about this in the past … I understand why this feels like a possibility because the theme of “history repeating itself” in ASOIAF is a recurrent one. However, in order for this to be achieved, it would come at the expense of D*ny’s arc as Mother of Dragons, which GRRM has taken great care to weave all through her story. I just don’t see her giving birth to a child. It would mean a complete denial of her choice of dragons vs. humans, independent of whether or not she survived the endgame. 

Also, in terms of the Ned/Catelyn parallel, it feels like overkill to me since Sansa, by the end of season 8, would be instrumental in rectifying her father and mother’s “mistakes” by making Jon a Stark through marriage. Which would mean that Sansa essentially bringing balance to that plot would be annulled by Jon bringing another bastard baby home and having the story repeat itself after only just resolving it. 

Instead of making the story come full circle, in this scenario, it would just be messy and not as meaningful as what Sansa had already done. 

Thanks for the ask!

summary: During the Battle of the Bastards it seemed like everything was entirely against Jon, all those arrows being shot at him, nearly...
question: During the Battle of the Bastards it seemed like everything was entirely against Jon, all those arrows being shot at him, nearly being crushed by the hoard of men. And when they went north of the wall, he definitely seemed doomed after being plunged in that lake and freezing his way back to the wall. It seems like he can’t be killed. Do you think there’s some magic involved there or just proof that he’s a total badass?
answer:
Hey, nonnie!

I don’t think there’s magic involved. It’s rather a pretty common suspension of disbelief when it comes to heroes in action sequences. They end up in perilous situations, they might get hurt but they won’t die because the plot demands that they don’t. So that explains the arrows during the Battle of the Bastards. 

As for his lake deep dive, the same rule applies, only this time the execution is much poorer so it’s hard to ignore. The whole wight hunt is a rather badly thought out plot whose only purpose narratively was to give the Night King a dragon. 

Could we also conclude that Jon is a total badass? Yeah, the man held his breath for 5 minutes under water, managed to swim back to the top with layers upon layers of fur on him, ride across the frozen wasteland in freezing temperatures without losing his sword or getting as much as a light cough. Total badass for sure! :))))

I guess if you want to make it more believable, you could argue that the same magic that brought him back to life is also looking out for him so to speak but I think that’s mostly a personal interpretation rather than something that will be explored in the show. 

Thanks for the ask!
